PARAGRAPH.STRING: , widely known as Le Corbusier (October 6, 1887- August 27, 1965), was a French Swiss born architect, famous for
contributions to what is now called modernism, or the International Style.
was a pioneer in theoretical studies of modern design and
was dedicated to providing better living conditions for the residents of crowded cities.
career spanned five decades, with iconic buildings constructed across central Europe, India, Russia, and one structure each in North and South America.
was also an urban planner, painter, sculptor, writer and modern furniture designer.
